page.title: 16Keadby Pumping Station
page.content: Three man-made rivers which drain a large area of the Isle of Axholme terminate atthe massive pumping station at Keadby.The outlets run under the B1392 road which runs alongside the River Trent.The station is maintained by the Severn Trent Water Authority.It serves 37,000 hectares of farmland.It houses 6 pumps,each 152cm in diameter,which can pump 32 cubic metres of water per second.There are 2 large exhaust fume chimneys outside the station.On site the maintenance man and his two assistants live so they are on hand if a flood should occur.The rivers are regularly kept clear of weeds.An Anglers Association from South Yorkshire holds the fishing rights. In winter excess water is pumped at low river from the land but in summer the farmers draw on it for spraying.
